trans-unit.source: Azure Notification Hubs Rich Push
trans-unit.target: Azure Notification Hubs Rich Push

trans-unit.source: Learn how to send rich push notifications to an iOS app from Azure. Code samples written in Objective-C and C#.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to send rich push notifications to an iOS app from Azure. Code samples written in Objective-C and C#.

trans-unit.source: In order to engage users with instant rich contents, an application might want to push beyond plain text.
trans-unit.target: In order to engage users with instant rich contents, an application might want to push beyond plain text.

trans-unit.source: These notifications promote user interactions and present content such as urls, sounds, images/coupons, and more.
trans-unit.target: These notifications promote user interactions and present content such as urls, sounds, images/coupons, and more.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial builds on the <linkText>Notify Users</linkText><title></title> topic, and shows how to send push notifications that incorporate payloads (for example, image).
trans-unit.target: This tutorial builds on the <linkText>Notify Users</linkText><title></title> topic, and shows how to send push notifications that incorporate payloads (for example, image).

trans-unit.source: This tutorial is compatible with iOS 7 & 8.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial is compatible with iOS 7 & 8.

trans-unit.source: At a high level:
trans-unit.target: At a high level:

trans-unit.source: The app backend:
trans-unit.target: The app backend:

trans-unit.source: Stores the rich payload (in this case, image) in the backend database/local storage
trans-unit.target: Stores the rich payload (in this case, image) in the backend database/local storage

trans-unit.source: Sends ID of this rich notification to the device
trans-unit.target: Sends ID of this rich notification to the device

trans-unit.source: App on the device:
trans-unit.target: App on the device:

trans-unit.source: Contacts the backend requesting the rich payload with the ID it receives
trans-unit.target: Contacts the backend requesting the rich payload with the ID it receives

trans-unit.source: Sends users notifications on the device when data retrieval is complete, and shows the payload immediately when users tap to learn more
trans-unit.target: Sends users notifications on the device when data retrieval is complete, and shows the payload immediately when users tap to learn more

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio, open the AppBackend project that you created in the Notify Users tutorial.
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio, open the AppBackend project that you created in the Notify Users tutorial.

trans-unit.source: Obtain an image you would like to notify users with, and put it in an img folder in your project directory.
trans-unit.target: Obtain an image you would like to notify users with, and put it in an img folder in your project directory.

trans-unit.source: Click Show All Files in the Solution Explorer, and right-click the folder to Include In Project.
trans-unit.target: Click Show All Files in the Solution Explorer, and right-click the folder to Include In Project.

trans-unit.source: With the image selected, change its Build Action in Properties window to Embedded Resource.
trans-unit.target: With the image selected, change its Build Action in Properties window to Embedded Resource.

trans-unit.source: In Notifications.cs, add the following using statement:
trans-unit.target: In Notifications.cs, add the following using statement:

trans-unit.source: Update the whole Notifications class with the following code.
trans-unit.target: Update the whole Notifications class with the following code.

trans-unit.source: Be sure to replace the placeholders with your notification hub credentials and image file name.
trans-unit.target: Be sure to replace the placeholders with your notification hub credentials and image file name.

trans-unit.source: (optional) Refer to <linkText>How to embed and access resources by using Visual C#</linkText><title></title> for more information on how to add and obtain project resources.
trans-unit.target: (optional) Refer to <linkText>How to embed and access resources by using Visual C#</linkText><title></title> for more information on how to add and obtain project resources.

trans-unit.source: In NotificationsController.cs, redefine NotificationsController with the following snippets.
trans-unit.target: In NotificationsController.cs, redefine NotificationsController with the following snippets.

trans-unit.source: This sends an initial silent rich notification id to device and allows client-side retrieval of image:
trans-unit.target: This sends an initial silent rich notification id to device and allows client-side retrieval of image:

trans-unit.source: Now we will re-deploy this app to an Azure Website in order to make it accessible from all devices.
trans-unit.target: Now we will re-deploy this app to an Azure Website in order to make it accessible from all devices.

trans-unit.source: Right-click on the AppBackend project and select Publish.
trans-unit.target: Right-click on the AppBackend project and select Publish.

trans-unit.source: Select Azure Website as your publish target.
trans-unit.target: Select Azure Website as your publish target.

trans-unit.source: Log in with your Azure account and select an existing or new Website, and make a note of the destination URL property in the Connection tab.
trans-unit.target: Log in with your Azure account and select an existing or new Website, and make a note of the destination URL property in the Connection tab.

trans-unit.source: We will refer to this URL as your backend endpoint later in this tutorial.
trans-unit.target: We will refer to this URL as your backend endpoint later in this tutorial.

trans-unit.source: Click Publish.
trans-unit.target: Click Publish.

trans-unit.source: Now that you have modified your app backend to send just the id of a notification, you will change your iOS app to handle that id and retrieve the rich message from your backend.
trans-unit.target: Now that you have modified your app backend to send just the id of a notification, you will change your iOS app to handle that id and retrieve the rich message from your backend.

trans-unit.source: Open your iOS project, and enable remote notifications by going to your main app target in the Targets section.
trans-unit.target: Open your iOS project, and enable remote notifications by going to your main app target in the Targets section.

trans-unit.source: Click on Capabilities, turn on Background Modes, and check the Remote Notifications checkbox.
trans-unit.target: Click on Capabilities, turn on Background Modes, and check the Remote Notifications checkbox.

trans-unit.source: Go to Main.storyboard, and make sure you have a View Controller (refered to as Home View Controller in this tutorial) from Notify User tutorial.
trans-unit.target: Go to Main.storyboard, and make sure you have a View Controller (refered to as Home View Controller in this tutorial) from Notify User tutorial.

trans-unit.source: Add a Navigation Controller to your storyboard, and control-drag to Home View Controller to make it the root view of navigation.
trans-unit.target: Add a Navigation Controller to your storyboard, and control-drag to Home View Controller to make it the root view of navigation.

trans-unit.source: Make sure the Is Initial View Controller in Attributes inspector is selected for the Navigation Controller only.
trans-unit.target: Make sure the Is Initial View Controller in Attributes inspector is selected for the Navigation Controller only.

trans-unit.source: Add a View Controller to storyboard and add an Image View.
trans-unit.target: Add a View Controller to storyboard and add an Image View.

trans-unit.source: This is the page users will see once they choose to learn more by clicking on the notifiication.
trans-unit.target: This is the page users will see once they choose to learn more by clicking on the notifiication.

trans-unit.source: Your storyboard should look as follows:
trans-unit.target: Your storyboard should look as follows:

trans-unit.source: Click on the Home View Controller in storyboard, and make sure it has homeViewController as its Custom Class and Storyboard ID under the Identity inspector.
trans-unit.target: Click on the Home View Controller in storyboard, and make sure it has homeViewController as its Custom Class and Storyboard ID under the Identity inspector.

trans-unit.source: Do the same for Image View Controller as imageViewController.
trans-unit.target: Do the same for Image View Controller as imageViewController.

trans-unit.source: Then, create a new View Controller class titled imageViewController to handle the UI you just created.
trans-unit.target: Then, create a new View Controller class titled imageViewController to handle the UI you just created.

trans-unit.source: In imageViewController.h, add the following to the controller's interface declarations.
trans-unit.target: In imageViewController.h, add the following to the controller's interface declarations.

trans-unit.target: Make sure to control-drag from the storyboard image view to these properties to link the two:

trans-unit.target: In imageViewController.m, add the following at the end of viewDidload:

trans-unit.source: In AppDelegate.m, import the image controller you created:
trans-unit.target: In AppDelegate.m, import the image controller you created:

trans-unit.source: Add an interface section with the following declaration:
trans-unit.target: Add an interface section with the following declaration:

trans-unit.source: In AppDelegate, make sure your app registers for silent notifications in application: didFinishLaunchingWithOptions:
trans-unit.target: In AppDelegate, make sure your app registers for silent notifications in application: didFinishLaunchingWithOptions:

trans-unit.source: Subsitute in the following implementation for application:didRegisterForRemoteNotificationsWithDeviceToken to take the storyboard UI changes into account:
trans-unit.target: Subsitute in the following implementation for application:didRegisterForRemoteNotificationsWithDeviceToken to take the storyboard UI changes into account:

trans-unit.source: Then, add the following methods to AppDelegate.m to retrieve the image from your endpoint and send a local notification when retrieval is complete.
trans-unit.target: Then, add the following methods to AppDelegate.m to retrieve the image from your endpoint and send a local notification when retrieval is complete.

trans-unit.source: Make sure to substitute the placeholder {backend endpoint} with your backend endpoint:
trans-unit.target: Make sure to substitute the placeholder {backend endpoint} with your backend endpoint:

trans-unit.source: Handle the local notification above by opening up the image view controller in AppDelegate.m with the following methods:
trans-unit.target: Handle the local notification above by opening up the image view controller in AppDelegate.m with the following methods:

trans-unit.source: In XCode, run the app on a physical iOS device (push notifications will not work in the simulator).
trans-unit.target: In XCode, run the app on a physical iOS device (push notifications will not work in the simulator).

trans-unit.source: In the iOS app UI, enter a username and password of the same value for authentication and click Log In.
trans-unit.target: In the iOS app UI, enter a username and password of the same value for authentication and click Log In.

trans-unit.source: Click Send push and you should see an in-app alert.
trans-unit.target: Click Send push and you should see an in-app alert.

trans-unit.source: If you click on More, you will be brought to the image you chose to include in your app backend.
trans-unit.target: If you click on More, you will be brought to the image you chose to include in your app backend.

trans-unit.source: You can also click Send push and immediately press the home button of your device.
trans-unit.target: You can also click Send push and immediately press the home button of your device.

trans-unit.source: In a few moments, you will receive a push notification.
trans-unit.target: In a few moments, you will receive a push notification.

trans-unit.source: If you tap on it or click More, you will be brought to your app and the rich image content.
trans-unit.target: If you tap on it or click More, you will be brought to your app and the rich image content.
